Name: sparse_autoencoder_scaling
Title: Scaling Laws and Evaluation Methods for Sparse Autoencoders in Language Models
Experiment:
The paper presents several key implementations and experiments:
1. A k-sparse autoencoder architecture using TopK activation function replacing traditional L1 penalty
2. Auxiliary loss (AuxK) and initialization techniques to prevent dead latents
3. Training methodology scaled up to 16M latent dimensions on GPT-4
4. Multiple evaluation metrics including:
   - Downstream loss
   - Feature probe recovery
   - N2G explanations for interpretability
   - Ablation sparsity measures
5. Systematic study of scaling relationships between:
   - Number of latents (n)
   - Sparsity level (k)
   - Model size
   - Compute budget
6. Analysis of progressive feature recovery and activation patterns

Name: hierarchical_sparse_autoencoder
Title: Hierarchical Sparse Autoencoders for Multi-Level Feature Extraction in Language Models
Experiment:
Implementation steps:
1. Progressive training pipeline:
   - Layer-wise pretraining
   - End-to-end fine-tuning
   - Residual connections
2. Layer-specific components:
   - Adaptive sparsity constraints
   - Feature redundancy penalties
   - Level-appropriate regularization
3. Evaluation methodology:
   - Hierarchy quality metrics
   - Feature abstraction measures
   - Cross-layer relationship analysis
   - Comparative baselines
4. Visualization and analysis:
   - Feature hierarchy maps
   - Composition patterns
   - Abstraction level control
5. Ablation studies:
   - Architecture components
   - Training strategies
   - Loss function terms
